intro: Dendrocnide kusaiana, commonly known as the Kusaian stinging tree, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species with stinging hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically broad and serrated. It is known for its potent urticating hairs that can cause severe skin irritation upon contact. This plant thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in rainforests and along coastal areas.
